column4: hi! If I have a RAID array (2 drives) and the bios software didn't recognize one of the drives as part of the array, asked me if I wanted to include it, not wants to rebuild the array, do I lose the data as a result of rebuilding the array?
very likely
can you still see the array in windows?
is there data on the drives you can't lose
yes, I'd rather not lose the data
so you had this array setup in ubuntu previously right
yes
did you set the array up with mdadm or via bios
I haven't had it setup as anything in Ubuntu
so how is there data on it?
in ubuntu it appears as a single drive
ok so previously, you set it up in the bios, then installed to /dev/sdd
which is an array that appears to ubuntu as one drive
right?
exactly
then, what happened ?
right so you rebooted and now your bios is complaining that a drive is not part of the array?
if that's the case go ahead and tell the bios to rebuild the array
right. It asked me that drive 0 is not part of the array, and if I want to include it. I said yes, and then it said it wants to rebuild the array
what's gonna happen?
yep, rebuild it
it's going to sync disk 0 with disk 1
might take awhile, depending on size
